snippet: India’s prime minister, the host, said he would visit Pakistan, a trip that many analysts regard as instrumental to any major diplomatic breakthroughs between the countries.
abstract: Pakistan's Pres Asif Ali Zardari meets with India's Prime Min Manmohan Singh in New Delhi, with both leaders expressing a mutual desire to improve relations between their rival nations; the meeting is the first of its kind in seven years; during talks, Singh announces that he plans to visit Pakistan, a trip that many analysts regard as instrumental to any major diplomatic breakthroughs between the countries.
lead_paragraph: India’s prime minister, the host, said he would visit Pakistan, a trip that many analysts regard as instrumental to any major diplomatic breakthroughs between the countries.

headline.seo: India and Pakistan Leaders Meet in Rare Visit
headline.main: Indian and Pakistani Leaders Encourage Ties in a Rare Visit
headline.print_headline: Indian and Pakistani Leaders Encourage Ties in a Rare Visit
